analysis: The statement cites the opinions of General Ridgway and Secretary Herter to support the argument about the indefensibility of Quemoy and Matsu. This constitutes an appeal to authority, as the speaker relies on the authority of these officials to bolster their position without providing independent evidence or analysis. While the officials are relevant experts, the argument hinges on their statements rather than substantive reasoning, fitting the definition of Appeal to Authority (1).
